REPORT THK S TATE OF NEBRASKA, TREASURY DEPARTMBft Lincoln, December 1, 1910. To his Excellence Ashton C. Shallenberger, Governor of Nebraska Sir: Pursuai requirements of law I have the honor to herewith report of this department for the biennium ending present Novemt iV I desire to call your attention that all general fund registered war- rants have been cancelled and no warrants have been registered in this fund since December 2, 1909, which is a very gratifying showing as this fund means that there is no debt, either floating or bonded, against the genera DO debt, either floating or bonded, against the general Nebraska. The receipts of this fund have been ample nee that time, and leaving a balance to date in means tliti fund of the State of Nebraska. The receipts of this fund have been ampl< fund of tht St to meet all expenditures since that time, anil leaving a balance to date 1 amount of $154,920.06. Prior to the 1st of December, 11108, the constitution provided for th mount of .4 1 mber, 1908, the constitution provided for the investment of our permanent school fund in United 8t >te Secur nt school fund in United States. State Securi of ties and County Bonds of Nebraska, and as no county bonds were Is ties and (' ■untv H )iids of Nebraska, and as no county bonds were issued ■braska during the biennium of 1907 and >f Educational Lands and Funds to go outside of the in the State of Nebraska during the biennium of 1907 am: jf N pelled the Board of Educational Lands and Funds to go outside of th Board state and purchase other state securities in order to keep this fund 1 state and purchase other ither state securities in order to keep this fund in vested according to law. Then in the fall of 1908 a constitutional amen ac rdin law. Then in the fall of 1908 a constitutional amend- nient was voted upon and carried, providing for the additional investmen ment was I up ion and carried, providing for the additional investment of registered school district bonds and such other securities as the legi of registered school district bonds and such other securities as the legi lature may, from time to time, direct. By authority given by the eonsti ime. di t By authority given by the consti- tutional amendment we have purcha.-ed since December 1, tutional amendment we have purcha.-ed sine*' December 1, M84,6S6:41 of school district bonds, and by authority given by the las. $484,655.41 of bond nd by authority given bv the last legislature, we have purchased |8<8,006.M of city and village boadi d $868 city and village bond in addition to this amount we have purchased $4> I county bond addi we h hased $430,( .00 of county bonds. pu which has taken all the money that this department has available fo k uoney that this department has available for investment without purchasing any state securities during the last bie 3OI purchasing any state securities during the last bien- nium. As you will note by the within report, we hold * • 00 o nium. As you will note by the within report, we hold $ • i>0 of bonds of other states and I would recommend that the legislature gi\ her and I would recommend that the legislature give the Board of Educational Lands and Funds authority to dispose of the Board rial Lands and Funds authority to dispose of bonds, if the same can be sold at par, in order to convert this mone ii I r, in order to convert this money in at into home securities which are being offered for sale in if th into horr amount of money available for investment. This would give the varioi school districts and municipalities a lower rate of interest and the n school (list wer rate of interest and the nioiit would be retained in our own shite rather than sending out of the The following summaries and statements are respectfullv submitte rather than sending out of the tatements are respectfully submitted LAWSOX G. BRIAN Treasurer
